Web. 9 Nov. 2010.{{cite web|title=Famous West Virginians|url=http://members.aol.com/jeff560/famousw.html|publisher=AOL|author=jeff560|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070305103441/http://members.aol.com/jeff560/famousw.html|archivedate=2007-03-05|date=2007-02-09}}[http://dailycartoonist.com/index.php/2011/09/19/ziggy-creator-tom-wilson-sr-passes-at-age-80/ Ziggy creator Tom Wilson Sr. passes at age 80 The Daily Cartoonist] better known as '''Tom Wilson''', was an [[United States|American]] [[cartoonist]]. Wilson was the creator of the comic strip ''[[Ziggy (comic strip)|Ziggy]]'', which he drew from 1971 to 1987. The strip was then continued by his son, Tom Wilson, Jr.{{cite news|title='Ziggy' cartoonist tells of depression |first=Paul |last=Clark |work=[[The Cincinnati Enquirer]] |publisher=[[Gannett Company]] |date=2009-03-02 |accessdate=2009-03-02 |url=http://news.cincinnati.com/article/20090302/ENT/90302004/ |quote=Much of the book derives from journals [Tom Wilson, Jr.] kept along the way, a practice he found therapeutic. Some were recorded on audiotape during his regular travels up [[Interstate 71]] between his home in Loveland and his business in [[Cleveland, Ohio|Cleveland]], a cartoon-character licensing and branding company called Character Matters. |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120323155813/http://news.cincinnati.com/article/20090302/ENT/90302004/ |archivedate=March 23, 2012 }} Wilson served in the U.S. Army from 1953 to 1955. He attended the [[Art Institute of Pittsburgh]], graduating in 1955. He was a [[Cooper Union]] art instructor from 1961 to 1962.{{cite book |last=Reynolds |first=Moira Davison| title=Comic Strip Artists in American Newspapers, 1945-1980 |year=2003 |publisher=McFarland |isbn=978-0-7864-1551-9 |page=170}} Wilson's career began in 1950, doing advertisement layouts for [[Uniontown, Pennsylvania|Uniontown]] Newspapers, Inc. In 1955, he joined [[American Greetings]] (AG) as a designer, becoming Creative Director in 1957 and vice-president of creative development in 1978. While at AG, he developed the Soft Touch greeting card line. He also served as president of [[Those Characters From Cleveland]], AG's character licensing subsidiary. ==''Ziggy''== The ''Ziggy'' comics panel, syndicated by [[Universal Uclick]] (formerly Universal Press Syndicate), launched in 15 newspapers in June 1971. It expanded to appear in more than 500 [[daily strip|daily]] and [[Sunday comics|Sunday newspapers]] and has been featured in bestselling books and calendars. ''Ziggy'' merchandising has included plaques, T-shirts, buttons, glass tumblers, lunch boxes, coffee mugs and greeting cards. In 2002, Ziggy became the official spokescharacter for the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society. Throughout his career, Wilson demonstrated a remarkable ability to anticipate future trends in the marketplace. A veteran of the licensing business, Wilson headed up the creative team that developed such character licensing blockbusters as [[Strawberry Shortcake]] and [[Care Bears]]. In 1987, Wilson passed the ''Ziggy'' torch to his son, Tom Wilson Jr., after the younger Wilson had served as an assistant on the strip for many years.{{Cite news | url=http://blog.bcdb.com/2011/09/tom-wilson-sr-creator-icon-ziggy-dead-80/ | work=BCDB Cartoon News | accessdate=2011-09-18 | title=Tom Wilson Sr., creator of icon Ziggy, dead at 80 | df= }}{{dead link|date=January 2018|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} Even though Tom Sr. lived in Cleveland and Tom Jr. lived in Cincinnati, the two worked as a team, collaborating by fax and phone. Wilson was a talented painter with works appearing in exhibitions throughout the United States, including the [[Cleveland Museum of Art]] and the [[Society of Illustrators]] annual show in [[New York City|New York]]. ==Awards== He made his mark in animation with the 1982 [[Emmy Award]]-winning Christmas special, ''[[Ziggy's Gift]]'', which was released on VHS video in 2002 and DVD in 2005. He received the Purchase award in the [[Butler Institute of American Art]]'s annual exhibition. Wilson was a survivor of [[lung cancer]]. ==Death== He died in his sleep on the night of September 16, 2011{{cite news |last= |first= |url= http://www.prweb.com/releases/2011/9/prweb8806450.htm |title=Ziggy Creator Tom Wilson Sr. Dead at 80 |work=[[PRWeb]] |date=2011-09-18 |accessdate=2011-09-18}} of pneumonia at a Cincinnati hospital.
